website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Transformer Book T200TA-C1-BL is a good detachable-hybrid tablet for just under $500. While most of its drawbacks are minor nits, there are other systems that give you more storage space and battery life, for the same price or less.
pros: User-accessible SATA hard drive bay in dock
cons: Only about 40GB free on solid-state drive (SSD)
Micro HDMI and micro USB port

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs some common sense
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard really needs more mass to counterbalance the tablet - it is awkward. Put a battery AND a SSD slot in it and you can kill two birds - fix the storage issues and add battery backups and it wouldn't really raise the price since these are addons. This unit is the only windows machine I have seen using 7 and higher that does not have a "no HD sleep" setting while on battery. Therefore, it has to be plugged in for all updates or it will sleep during them. Skip a few updates in this way and you end up with a very unfriendly machine as my wife learned.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: it works great. As some others have said
customer_reviews.text: This notebook works really well for office products and movies. I'm not a gamer so I can't attest to that. However, for what I use it for, it works great. As some others have said, the keyboard portion and the tablet portion feel flimsy and cheap. However, I've been using mine for about 7 months now and it is still operational. The only real big complaint that I have is that sometimes, when the lid is close, it will simply shut down. It's supposed to go into sleep mode. It doesn't happen everytime and it's hard to pinpoint the conditions in which this happens. Overall, it's a really good notebook/tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Thoob

customer_reviews.title: Light Powerful Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this convertible netbook/tablet based on reviews, price and past experience with ASUS. I was not disappointed. Boot time and processor speed are speedy. I'm running Adobe Creative Suite CS6 with good to excellent performance. I use a single cable USB drive almost exclusively for file and project storage. I'm finding little this powerful netbook cannot do. In fact, nothing so far. Editing 2K video, Netflix, 3D modeling...I'm just pleased to have a powerful, compact and versatile tool at this price. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William Hunter Cressall

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife last Christmas and she loves it. It has no problems playing games as well like World of Warcraft, as long as you don't expect to run everything at maximum. We also bought a docking station/keyboard and installed a 250 Samsung SSD, which I would highly recommend since the 64GB drive fills up quick if you plan to install games.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B

customer_reviews.title: Not altogether bad, but you can get a faster laptop for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not altogether bad, but you can get a faster laptop for just a little bit more, if you want to. I wanted a mobile platform for writing code and reports, checking email and playing the occasional game. This did those things OK, but felt very cheap and was not very quick at doing any of it. I paid $450 for it, but for $510 I was able to get a Dell 13 7000 laptop that is vastly superior in every way except size. It's not bad, but it's at the expensive side for a tablet/portable combo and in that price range you have to compete with smaller laptops. In my case, the laptop won. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Know what to accept!
customer_reviews.text: PROCESSING PERFORMANCE: CSGO LOWEST RESOLUTION LOWEST SETTINGS: Around 40FPS playable. Portal 2 Default Settings: Playable and good, but lags at a few spots. If you don't game it's great! But seriously: The Dell Venue Pro 11 is the same price including the keyboard for a much better core i5 processor. The back comes off with a snap so you can replace the battery or add a sim card and an 3G care with the mini PCIe bus. THIS COULD ALLOW YOU TO ADD A eGPU with the exp gdc from banggood.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Murray

customer_reviews.title: Honestly was so nice
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing. It was a perfect college machine. It was fast enough for what I wanted to do and the fact that I could disconnect the keyboard when I got done with my school work and could watch Netflix and YouTube was so nice. The battery life is amazing on this. I would have kept it too, but unfortunately I purchased this used from amazon warehouse and there was a defect in the spring that connected the tablet to the keyboard, so it wouldn't lock. If it didn't have that and the price didn't spike after I bought it I would have ordered a new one. I still recommend to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: A lot of little issues that are super annoying. I am not sure if we just ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot of little issues that are super annoying. I am not sure if we just got a bad egg because none of the problems we are having have previously been reported, but weird issues such as occasionally turning it on to an insanely loud, mechanical noise that won't go away unless you manually CTRL+ALT+DEL shutdown. Not to mention, the keyboard has a really difficult time detecting the monitor when attached and beeps constantly as if the monitor is constantly sliding out even though it is not. These are just a couple of the issues that didn't start until about a couple of months in.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Rife Magalis

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop/tablet, Can't wait to see what Asus does next.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have really enjoyed this computer. It is a little top heavy, as it is a tablet with a keyboard attachment, but it still really enjoy the overall experience I have had with the Asus. I have installed a 120 GB SSD in the keyboard for extra storage space and I often use USB drives to transfer data. The tablet/laptop is great in almost all aspects. It is one of the fastest tablets I have used and I also use it to remote connect to my monster of a desktop. I would recommend this tablet for anyone who is tech savvy and needs a ethernet port for school or work.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Work fine except it has a way of hanging up and ...
customer_reviews.text: Work fine except it has a way of hanging up and I have to turn it off to kill the task. This is annoying as I have to hold down the off button for about 20 seconds for this shut off. The location of the speakers is another issue. The need to be placed forward as they have to be turned up to hear clearly of one in is a noisy room. It one places a reflector behind the unit then you get more out of the sound as it is not lost in space. Maybe someone can look at redesigning the case to help reflect to sound forward
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Weston

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet, cheap glass
customer_reviews.text: So far its pretty awesome. The keyboard seems to come loose pretty easy sometimes. This is an updated review going from 4 to 3 stars. After using the tablet for just 2 months the cheap glass cracked and couldn't be fixed. Thanks to square trade accident protection they refunded the price of the tablet. I really liked using the tablet but am going to pay a little more on a Microsoft surface or Samsung ativ for the gorilla glass option. Apparently Asus just cut too many corners to keep the price down.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Law

customer_reviews.title: Weak glass screen, but otherwise a nice product.
customer_reviews.text: I like this transform book a lot, but the screen turned out to be very sensitive and cracked within the first month after purchase due to slight bumping. I've never had such a large touchscreen, but with Windows OS heading in that direction, I'm surprised by how easily something made for Windows 8+ is so susceptible to damage. The warranty is only covers the US, and I'm unfortunately studying abroad so even if my claim were covered, I couldn't be helped. Love the idea, the overall product is a bit weak unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet/computer...bad keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchasing the 10" Transformer and loved it, accept for the small keyboard. I moved to the 12" thinking it would be the same thing with a bigger keyboard. No doubt, the 12" Asus Transformer is a good tablet/computer. The problem is, again, the keyboard. It is indeed bigger, but underneath the keyboard is hollow for an extra hard drive. Because of this empty space, the keyboard is spongy and sounds like something akin to a child's toy. I thought I could get used to it, but to no avail. I have finally bit the bullet and purchased a Surface Pro 3.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for play and work. Even my CAD system works on here.
customer_reviews.text: Runs smoothly, no problems. Light and compact, but big enough to watch movies on it and work on documents. Keyboard has a good feel and is big enough to type comfortably. The detachable keyboard turns it into a tablet for sitting on the couch and surfing or watching movies. The keyboard and USB ports for a mouse or memory sticks turns it into a laptop. I am running openoffice for windows without any problems. What surprised me the most was that even my CAD system works on here and relatively fast. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T.

customer_reviews.title: Love ASUS products
customer_reviews.text: Love ASUS products, but this just feels cheap. Plastic body creaks and flexs on both keyboard and tablet, so it will need extra packing in my day pack. Overall heavier than expected, especially in the tablet area, so you can't lean the screen to far back or it loses balance. OS and device run nice and cool, tho, so no complaints there. Good alternative to much higher priced combos, just be aware that it doesn't feel as sturdy as it could.
customer_reviews.author: GTI

customer_reviews.title: Versatile laptop/tablet with better than expected performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a great low cost tablet/laptop. I bought this primarily to use for sales demos in the field without being overly invested in a more expensive laptop. The T200 has the convenience of a tablet yet runs full Windows 8.1. The atom processor performs way better than I expected. I installed a SSD in the drive bay under the keyboard. Now I have all the storage I need for mobile sales presentations.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: A Great two-in-one Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use as I visit various customers for the company where I work. It's a very reasonably priced tablet I use often.
customer_reviews.author: F. May

customer_reviews.title: nice notepad \ laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pad \keyboard unit. that fit between a notepad and laptop and this is it. this is running office and coral draw and autocad plus solid works drawing programs. I am very happy with this unit. I even put a $50 harddrive into this guy for loading programs. the only thing is the key board feels a little soft but works fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen and audio not working after upgrade to Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this T200TA around November 2014. Just upgraded to Windows 10 last month. After the upgrade, the touch screen and audio is not working, I reset it and reinstall Windows 10 several times, tried to reinstall the drivers, the touth screen and audio still not working. It took me so much time to try to solve these problems and I finally gave up. Besides these two problems, this computer runs ok.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: I am quite pleased with this computer
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with this computer. I am able to use it as a regular laptop/netbook, or with a simple push of a button, a tablet. The computer performs well, although a particular piece of software I use to monitor my cpap does not seem to run very well. But then again, it runs slow on my other computer, which is much more powerful. That's the only problem I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Beemon

customer_reviews.title: Neat machine... but lots of issues updating windows software.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: Neat little machine. Responsive screen, portable. Con's: TONS OF WINDOWS update errors, like 100 windows updates to apply. BUT many errors when installing them.... day three of trying to fix all the update problems. If you are not a nerd, don't get windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Aboobika

customer_reviews.title: I love this Asus Transformer book
customer_reviews.text: I love this Asus Transformer book...I've wanted a computer that could double as a laptop and tablet... this T200 is perfect for being productive as a laptop and then a wonderful tool when doing presentations in tablet mode. It comes with Windows 8 and Office 365, very fast, powerful processor, and the display is incredible! I couldn't be happier with this Transformer Book... a very well designed and engineered tablet/laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always power on
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and idea of the 2-in-1. So far I've noticed the tablet does not always come on at the first press of the power button. The battery level will show instead. This may happen a few times even when I hold down the power button for a while. Not sure if this is happening with other units. Other than that, I like how light it is compared to my previous laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with decision to purchase the Asus T200
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and was deciding between this and the Microsoft Surface Pro, but this had the better price for me and I plan to take this computer travelling long-term. So far I am happy with everything - the long battery life, the display, the sound. I also ordered a 1TB internal hard drive through Amazon and had it installed in a Best Buy, so now I have extra storage when the tablet is docked. I wanted something to basically replace my laptop, and this was just right for my needs (streaming video, uploading/editing photos, e-mails, Skype, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: SCUBASC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tablet Combo
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, especially in that the keyboard can hold an SSD hard drive and has usb 3.0. The SSD install was very straight forward and it works really well. The tablet is comfortable and intuitive, fast and powerful. Would buy again or recommend to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Loudon

customer_reviews.title: Asus refused to make good on it
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard failed within first year, Asus replaced at no charge, but when replaced motherboard failed within 7 months, Asus refused to make good on it. Wanted to charge hundreds of dollars to replace, after tussling with on-line support was offered a 50% discount to fix it--not a good deal as it would still cost hundreds and they don't stand behind what they make! Tablet was gently used by adult (not carried around in backpack) and should not have 2 failed motherboards. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is really great fit for me
customer_reviews.text: Is really great fit for me. got it to replace my Laptop. Docking Mechanism is very Sturdy. had difficulty upgrading to windows 10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The computer often times fails to startup, shows a ...
customer_reviews.text: The computer often times fails to startup, shows a green battery and then shuts off. You often have to press this 3-5 times to get it to actually turn on. And the computer is fully charged when I do this. Also, it is noticeably slower than advertised and does have quite a bit of bloatware.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lada

customer_reviews.title: Great table or laptop
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished. Either a tablet or a laptop and light. Battery does not always read the proper time left but it works great. I let win 10 install over 8.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Little

customer_reviews.title: Great without keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This ASUS was a nice introduction to Windows 8.1. Worked well. Just a little heavier than I would have liked. The keyboard however, it was a pain, drained the battery of the tablet greatly. But otherwise, it was a great hybrid
customer_reviews.author: Adrilisa

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The laptop has all the features as promised. I was looking for a handy, portable computer with the detachable tablet feature. I figured that I only needed it for light internet browsing, maybe a little video streaming, and Microsoft Office. It performs well most of the time, but other times it can get really bogged down and freezes up a bit. I would recommend getting as much memory and hard drive space as you can.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Orton

customer_reviews.title: Very Portable
customer_reviews.text: It is a little slow compared to my desk top but it is very portable and does all I need it to do. I use it primarly to watch streaming movies on my large 55" smart TV. Like the number of USB ports and it boots very fast compared to other I have used or had.
customer_reviews.author: Mntlvr

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I watched the entire Breaking Bad series and I've written about 30k words of a novel all in about 2 months. Great for work and play. Battery life is much better than a similarly equipped laptop. And it's lighter. And it's better than a tablet because it's got the full Windows OS. Awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David List

customer_reviews.title: would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Works great, snappy response time on OS and video, wifi works good, like the Ethernet jack, overall keyboard and screen size fine. Minus one star because I wish it opened up a bit wider - it opens to about 100 degrees and then it stops. Everyone else is fine with it but I find it a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: G. Millikan

customer_reviews.title: I have been waiting for device like this that I could afford and this one is ...
customer_reviews.text: Freedom at last from the weight of my 17in laptop and the cumbersome brief cases needed to carry the laptop. As a secretary of my organization the T200TA tablet-laptop 3.6 lbs. is much easier to transport to and fro. I have been waiting for device like this that I could afford and this one is perfect for my needs, I added a 256 SSD to the bay slot and a 64GB SD card to the tablet and office pro 13. I did not buy this tablet for movies or games. All programs works, no problem all Pros no Cons.
customer_reviews.author: Odelle R. Small

customer_reviews.title: Both my daughter and her husband were especially pleased that the keyboard section has a slot for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present for my daughter. She was thrilled to get it. Both my daughter and her husband were especially pleased that the keyboard section has a slot for a second hard drive to increase the storage capacity of this ultra book.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst computer I have ever owned. That's all I have to say.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sherman

customer_reviews.title: What a good value this device is
customer_reviews.text: What a good value this device is. The keyboard is great for entering large amounts of information and doing email. I detach the display, sit out on the back porch, and enjoy reading. The battery runs for only about 4-5 hours when using WiFi but that is understandable. Overall, a great product for the price and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A.

customer_reviews.title: The adapter driver has been uninstalled twice and new ones have been installed but it doesn't work any better. Please do not was
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is awful and I wish I could return it. It is extremely slow to respond. With the windows 10 upgrade it has trouble connecting to wireless networks. The adapter driver has been uninstalled twice and new ones have been installed but it doesn't work any better. Please do not waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Keava

customer_reviews.title: Not the best product Asus has ever produced
customer_reviews.text: Not the best product Asus has ever produced, but also not the worst. Biggest downsides to the T200 is simply in it's form factor, which is shockingly ugly in comparison to the rest of the devices in its class. Powerful enough for basic computing and some very light gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn F.

customer_reviews.title: or the keyboard except for functions like brightness its fixed with a restart but very odd ...
customer_reviews.text: occasionally when starting up or after sleep mode(? being closed while on for a while) the trackpad doesnt work, or the keyboard except for functions like brightness its fixed with a restart but very odd otherwise works well, can even handle an old third person game
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTH THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: I love the 2 sided camera/video, the detachment into a tablet, the light weight, durability, and ease of use of this product. I had previously bought the 10" ASUS (the screen was a bit small) and unfortunately it was damaged by hospital staff while I was an inpatient for 41 days. I still have tons to learn about this computer, but, its been a fun process!
customer_reviews.author: Tony E. Robles

customer_reviews.title: Mobile Property Assessment Tool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for use as a mobile workstation by our local Assessment office while they're in the field. Loaded with ArcGIS, ProVal and MSSQL Standard. Provides property record look up for in field comparison and notes.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Carrell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased the Asus t100, and had several issues with it. Exchanged it through Amazon and replaced it with this. Not a single problem since. This is a great tablet for those looking for a nice compliment to a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it is a wonderful computer so
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace first one as sleep mode drains battery, but it does happen in the replacement too, but it is not a big deal as it boots up very fast. it also has a bug on key "A", that sometimes it lightly pressed, jumps to previous field. Also sometimes it does not recognize physical keyboard. Other than that it is a wonderful computer so far
customer_reviews.author: mahatma

customer_reviews.title: Sorry
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was sure this was going to be wonderful. Unfortunately I was wrong. I wish I could say that I liked it but I didn't. It's heavy, clunky and horrible to type on. I do however like the touch screen and its a great idea to be able to take it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. Make sure to buy some kind of memory (microSD card or hard drive in the base) because even with 64MB of internal memory it gets used up fast if you want to save anything.
customer_reviews.author: AJ R

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that it can be used with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The laptop met my expectations, it is a quality product. I like the fact that it can be used with the keyboard or as a tablet. I recommend getting the "IVSO ASUS Transformer Book T200TA Ultra Lightweight Slim Smart Cover Case" to protect it when used as a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Madruga

customer_reviews.title: Support is poor and its not windows 10
customer_reviews.text: posted review under cover by mistake. Stay away from ASUS. Support is poor and its not windows 10 compatible
customer_reviews.author: Little Snooters

customer_reviews.title: The perfect travelling computer
customer_reviews.text: A superb travel computer/tablet. Add a mouse and it will do all your computing needs. Although there was no office program, Libre Office, a free office-like application, loaded easily and works great.
customer_reviews.author: JB Samson

customer_reviews.title: I really like this 2-in-1
customer_reviews.text: I really like this 2-in-1. I read through the reviews and agree that it is heavier than other options out there but the ram and storage space were more important to me. This is a great deal in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Shantel Somerlott

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I got my monies worth on this one. Great to play my games and research.
customer_reviews.author: ab myrtle beach, sc

customer_reviews.title: But I would like to tell my own pros and cons to here
customer_reviews.text: Actually, many people have mentioned many pros and cons of this product. But I would like to tell my own pros and cons to here. Pros : High resoultion with compatible display size to me, great ui with windows 8, can use detailed settings Cons : Not easy to initialize this product to my taste(hdd not recognized first, language changing not very good), hard to be used to this product(for computer novices)
customer_reviews.author: Candymate

customer_reviews.title: ... tends to need to be rebooted more than I like, but the features vs
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft OS tends to need to be rebooted more than I like, but the features vs. the problems worth the problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this for anyone that wants a tablet bit needs ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my college bond daughter. It's quick and responsive handles office and other programs well. Would recommend this for anyone that wants a tablet bit needs laptop functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Steven marcus

customer_reviews.title: Cheap keyboard construction, but pretty good performance.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap keyboard construction, but pretty good performance. Support website kind of mess.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. AJ

customer_reviews.title: could be Adobe trying to be smart about what device its running on
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard seems a little lightweight - we'll see over time. Having some issues with Lightroom 6, could be Adobe trying to be smart about what device its running on.
customer_reviews.author: nh_handyman

customer_reviews.title: but I absolutely love it. I don't need a lot of horsepower ...
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical about this laptop after reading the reviews, but I absolutely love it. I don't need a lot of horsepower in a laptop as I only use it for a few things. I bought this roughly 18 months ago and it is still doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Not really happy with it. The cursor jumps all over the place while typing. Also, I have to reset the network adapter about once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Odom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small size PC and tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with its size and portability. I added a 500gb hard drive and a 2tb portable drive. I am still getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: horrible battery performance
customer_reviews.text: the battery doesnt last more than 4 hrs not as advertised when the battery finishes and you plugged in the charge it doesnt turn on till after a few minutes that the battery starts charching the sleep mode drains out all the battery in a few hours.... look for lenovo yoga 2 much better computer.
customer_reviews.author: eduardo davidsohn

customer_reviews.title: Four stars only, sorry ASUS.
customer_reviews.text: Only issue I have with this is that sometimes it doesn't cut on right away. Other than that, I'm happy with the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: alexhortdog95

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome lil machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome lil machine. More laptop than tablet really. Runs all the things I do. Sims3, internet, netflix, etc. perf!
customer_reviews.author: Phoenixliv

customer_reviews.title: The tablet is awesome. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is awesome. Unfortunately, the keyboard is cheap crap. It's flimsy, and doesn't have enough weight to balance the tablet portion. It bounces around during use, causing the cursor to move around on the page. This results in many errors. It's too bad, because the tablet is awesome, and with a quality keyboard, it would be a five star product. It's fast, the picture is great, and I would have been happy to keep it. Unfortunately, the keyboard is a total deal-breaker and it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm5775

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have been very pleased with this unit so far. Works very well with and without the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: VERY Satisfied User
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. Added an SSD drive to the device. Works very well So far. Very portable and convenient for meetings & travel.
customer_reviews.author: AXA

customer_reviews.title: Worth Considering if you are looking in this size.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for me to use as a second computer. The tablet section is handy for when I am away from a desk. I had an Android tablet before but it lacked the ease of productivity you have with Windows based programs. Since I can use a wireless mouse via usb and connect a larger screen via micro hdmi, I find it very useable in different situations. The biggest negative I have found is the keyboard. The feel is a bit on the toy side of the fence. It functions well, but the feel and the feedback from the keys seems cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ricci

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Good quality, fast and compatible with the rest of our electronic devices that we have at home.
customer_reviews.author: yennefer

customer_reviews.title: Love my school computer
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed the mobility. I have experienced not issues. It is a great school computer.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Liming

customer_reviews.title: So far So good
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I want. Windows 10 updated without a problem. Added a SSD without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet. Sent it to my son who added more apps and transferred items from an old computer to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard prevents the tablet from going to sleep so ...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard prevents the tablet from going to sleep so the battery drains whenever we fold it shut without fully powering down.
customer_reviews.author: SharkParty

customer_reviews.title: Speed is good for form factor
customer_reviews.text: Light and ultra portable. Speed is good for form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Real.Human.

customer_reviews.title: Great computer/tablet. I had tried an android tablet but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great computer/tablet. I had tried an android tablet but needed to go to Win 8 to get the productivity software that I needed.
customer_reviews.author: withasword

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice little tablet laptop
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little tablet laptop. Decent specs and an expansion bay to increase your storage. The thing that bothers me most about this is the touch screen. It's not very responsive to styluses, even the capacitive one I used did not work very well without leaving gaps. But then again, it is a budget laptop.
customer_reviews.author: mahid5000

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So versatile, big enough, lots of apps, clear screen, still finding new things it does
customer_reviews.author: Jrschappellsr

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in the product and Asus customer service. The screen cracked (multiple cracks) where the screen locks into the keyboard (was not dropped). Asus will not warranty (only 3 months old). Worse yet... they cannot even tell me if they have the part in service to repair it or how much it would cost. I basically paid for a touch screen they now barely works by keyboard. I also took to Best Buy (their authorized repair dealer), who also cannot tell me if they have the parts to replace or cost. In both cases I have to send in the machine for anyone to tell me anything. I will never buy another Asus product.
customer_reviews.author: ds

customer_reviews.title: I have had my ASUS Transformer Book 12-Inch T200TA for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had my ASUS Transformer Book 12-Inch T200TA for two weeks now. I am using it to replace my laptop for college. So far I have had zero problems with this device.
customer_reviews.author: bkay

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only bad thing is screen does not open much past vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Lofar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet, use pdf annotator for notes on pdf, great screen, nice speed
customer_reviews.author: MrSlippery

customer_reviews.title: The product is excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent so far. It is doing what it promised to do. Also, the delivery was well on time. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Delson Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great transformer book
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Asus for a couple months and I love it! I like having the ability to use it as a tablet or a laptop. It is pretty small so it's kind of hard for me to type on but overall it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: My first laptop/notebook purchase and I am more than pleased! I am not much of a technological person
customer_reviews.text: My first laptop/notebook purchase and I am more than pleased! I am not much of a technological person, and I have found this easy to use and learn on. Great value, love the detachable notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Robin D Herron CCC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice laptop, i liked it vey much...tab form is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Sree

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ASUS transformer book, easy to use and convenient. Would highly recommend it. I am just having a hard time trying to get a connection to internet when I am not at home. I have tried everything but can't seem to get it going. Any thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Caldario

customer_reviews.title: Good convertible, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for over a month now and I'm liking it a lot. It's honestly a bit lacking in tablet mode, hence only four stars, but as a laptop it is quite good. The screen has a plastic layer; it's not glass like most tablets. It's also a bit bulky as a tablet, in part because of the large bezel. The extra width does result in a much more comfortable keyboard though. The keyboard and touchpad are both very solid. Performance wise this device is also pretty impressive. It's much faster than other Atom devices like the Venue 8 pro. Overall I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: She is using it to surf the internet and we like this computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a present to my wife. She is using it to surf the internet and we like this computer. We like the idea that it can transform to a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: yossi nisenboim

customer_reviews.title: Great 2 in 1
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for over a month now and love it. Love the ability to use as a tablet or laptop. Thought at first that not having a cd/dvd drive would be a problem, but really not an issue as everything can be downloaded directly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Scott

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed, The Keyboard is not working anymore keeping in ...
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed, The Keyboard is not working anymore keeping in mind that I don't use it much, I'm an asus fanboy but I wouldn't buy an asus product again.
customer_reviews.author: Abdallah M.

customer_reviews.title: The T200 is a great computer. Versatile
customer_reviews.text: The T200 is a great computer. Versatile, reasonable price, tablet and laptop. My only real gripe is that no manual of any type was included so I had to search the web for an online version.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Buzzell

customer_reviews.title: Save your money...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing purchase, but I should have known better. I should have just saved my money and sprung for an IPAD! This thing is unreliable, and not very easy to use. The battery is constantly dead, and it's not like I overuse it. It freezes up constantly and the controls to turn it on don't always work. It was a total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Pysh

customer_reviews.title: super light and portable
customer_reviews.text: Little monster,runs average games(GTA SA,classic games,minecraft),let's me code in any language without crashing,super light and portable...the best way to spend my money,love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Díaz

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard. Like the display. Would like it more if it was brighter. Also would like it more if it had more internal memory. Over all I'm glad I got it and would recommend it to others
customer_reviews.author: Barnett Brickner

customer_reviews.title: so far so good the touching screen is sensitive enough and the reaction ...
customer_reviews.text: just get the t200ta today and used for few minutes, so far so good the touching screen is sensitive enough and the reaction of this "computer" is good comment on it in detail after longer time using
customer_reviews.author: TAI PAN ngai

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! What a computer, I am still learning so much about it. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: V.B.

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and versatile laptop/tablet hybrid for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Convenient to use as a laptop or as a tablet. Connects easily to the internet via wi-fi. The touchpad is highly responsive, as is the touchscreen. Nice selection of ports - USB, HDMI, LAN and audio - provide added versatility. The computer has a solid, sturdy feel and looks attractive. Images on the screen are crisp and clear. Other computers may have sharper cameras and higher-fidelity speakers, but for the price, the features of this ASUS can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ideator

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Piece of expensive JUNK. On/off switch quit working after just a few tries. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: got exactly what i expected to get. didnt notice any damage either
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ejimah

customer_reviews.title: This works wonderfully! It runs all of my computer programs and ...
customer_reviews.text: This works wonderfully! It runs all of my computer programs and works perfect as a tablet. Definitely get this if you're looking for best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Nikiradia

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought a T100 that broke in the first year. Now I bought a T200 to replace the T100 and broke in the first year again. The worst is that the guarantee of Asus does not fix even paying.
customer_reviews.author: Leandro Leão

product_meta.title: ASUS Transformer Book T200TA-C1-BL 2-in-1 Detachable 11.6" Laptop, 4 GB RAM 64 GB Storage
product_meta.description:
ASUS Transformer Book T200TA-C1-BL 11.6 Inch Laptop (Dark Blue), Intel Quad-Core Bay Trail-T Z3795 1.6GHz (Turbo up to 2.39GHz), 4GB DDR3 (1067MHz), 64GB SSD, 802.11AGN, Bluetooth, Windows 8.1

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Intel 64 Bit Quad Core Baytrail-T Z3795 1.59GHz (Turbo up to 2.39GHz). 4GB RAM.
Includes Keyboard Dock with USB 3.0 port, USB 2.0 Port, and Ethernet Port.
Smart HD Bay in Dock allows for Self-Upgradable Standard 2.5-inch Hard Drive (up to 1TB)
9-Hour battery life. 2MP Webcam and 5MP Rear Camera. microHDMI, microUSB, microSDXC slot. Wireless Dual-Band 802.11ABGN and Bluetooth 4.0.
